text: Credit spreads tighten as investors turn optimistic on corporate earnings.
High-yield bond market under pressure amid growing default concerns.
Calmer tone in credit markets as central bank hints at slower rate hikes.
Government bond yields fall after dovish comments from the central bank.
Analysts see limited upside for risky credit as recession fears persist.
Investor appetite for investment-grade corporate bonds improves.
Credit markets shrug off earlier volatility; spreads remain stable.
Ratings agency upgrades several high-yield issuers, citing stronger fundamentals.
Flight to safety pushes government bond prices higher.
Corporate default rate remains contained despite tighter financial conditions.
